name: Fractured Famous Women Quiz / Test | Fractured People | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
Dolly Madison & Dolley Madison.

	She was President James Madison's wife. There are some snack cakes named after her, too.

Senator Dianne Feinstein.

	California's Senator Feinstein, a centrist Democrat, is a former San Francisco mayor. Head of the San Francisco Board of Supervisors, she stepped into the mayor's post after Dan White assassinated George Moscone (and Harvey Milk).

Charlotte Bronte.

	Charlotte Bronte wrote 'Jane Eyre,' and her sister Emily wrote 'Wuthering Heights.'

Julia Roberts.

	She won an Oscar for her role in 'Erin Brockovich.'

Jacqueline Kennedy.

	She worked in publishing during the last part of her life.

Helen Hunt.

	She was great in 'Mad About You' and terrific in her Oscar-winning role in 'As Good as It Gets' with Jack Nicholson

Condoleezza Rice.

	A former Stanford University provost, National Security Advisor 'Condi' Rice is fluent in Russian, AND she's a classical pianist.

Rosie O'Donnell.

	Did you see her in the second 'Stake Out' movie with Richard Dreyfuss and Emilio Estevez? She was absolutely hilarious!

Grace Kelly & Princess Grace.

	If you haven't seen her in 'Rear Window' with Jimmy Stewart, you must! She's exquisite.

Geraldine Ferraro.

	Congresswoman Ferraro made history in 1984 when she became the first woman (major party) candidate for Vice-President. She ran unsuccessfully alongside Walter Mondale. Unfortunately her two United States Senate bids did not succeed, either. She became a TV commentator and recovered from a serious illness.

Elizabeth Taylor.

	She was earnest and sweet in 'National Velvet,' dazzlingly beautiful in 'Father of the Bride,' and impressively raunchy in 'Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?' She raised millions for HIV research and treatment. She's been married MANY times!

Jane Austen.

	She's my favorite writer! Please visit the Jane Austen category if you like her, too. And please join our Jane Austen Lovers group (#116).

Jennifer Lopez.

	'J. Lo' is a good comic actor, it turns out. Did you see in the 'Saturday Night Live' skit, 'Good Morning Bronx'? She played a local TV anchorwoman and she was hilarious.

questions.correct: J.K. Rowling & JK Rowling & J K Rowling & J. K. Rowling
questions.explanation:
J.K. Rowling & JK Rowling & J K Rowling & J. K. Rowling

	Wow, I just heard she's the second-richest woman in English, next to Queen Elizabeth. Her Harry Potter books are terrific, if you haven't read them.

Betty Ford.

	Gerald's wife. The substance abuse recovery clinic named for her is so famous that even fictional soap opera characters (like AMC's Erica Kane) go there.
